com.yantra.api.ycp.task

Interface getNextTask

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    YIFApi, com.yantra.api.YSCApi
    Deprecated. 
    as of 9.2.

    public interface getNextTask

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Deprecated Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document getNextTask(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)

      The getNextTask API takes into account user level pre-defined constraints and run-time constraints.

    • Method Detail

      • getNextTask

        org.w3c.dom.Document getNextTask(YFSEnvironment env,
                                 org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                          throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException,
                                 java.rmi.RemoteException
        Deprecated. 
        The getNextTask API takes into account user level pre-defined constraints and run-time constraints. Based on these constraints, the task suggestion algorithm suggests a set of tasks from the available pool of tasks.

        If /GetNextTask/TaskType is passed then tasks are picked up only for the passed task type.
        If /GetNextTask/TaskType is not passed, then tasks are suggested based on user's skill set.

        The getNextTask API has been enhanced to take EquipmentId as input.

        If EquipmentId is passed then the task types considered by the API depends on the equipment type of passed equipment.
        If the equipment type has associated task types then only associated task types are considered.
        Else task types considered are :
        1. having equipment type as primary equipment type and PerfTaskUsingEquipType flag true.
        2. having PerfTaskUsingEquipType flag false.

        If EquipmentId is not passed task types considered are having PerfTaskUsingEquipType flag false.

        getNextTask API gives preference to tasks assigned to the user over other tasks.

        While suggesting tasks getNextTask API considers the Aisle User Constraints and Zone User Constraints. A task will be considered only if the number of users currently working in the source aisle of the task does not violate the maximum number of users allowed. Besides a task will not be considered if another user is currently working at the source location of the task and the source zone of the task is configured to disallow multiple users simultaneously in a location.

        The tasks returned by getNextTask API are ordered using the attributes passed in the input (under OrderBy input xml tag) in conjunction with the following parameters:

        1. TaskPriority
        2. ReferenceSortSequence - This number is calculated based on the order in which a group of Waves or MoveRequests got released.
        3. FinishNoLaterThan
        4. SourceSortSequence - PickSequence or PutawaySequence of the Source Location (Depends on the Task Type configuration).
        5. SourceLocationId
        6. PrimaryTaskReference - WaveNo or MoveRequestNo or ContainerNo etc.
        7. ItemId
        7. SerialNo
        8. PrimaryTaskReference - WaveNo or MoveRequestNo or ContainerNo etc.
        9. TaskId

        If the user provides CurrentLocation then tasks with SourceLocations ahead of the current Location with
        higher or equal SortSequence are suggested. Once the user starts executing tasks, CurrentLocation becomes
        the last Location scanned.

        Tasks are suggested if
        1.Available Quantity is greater than or equal to task Quantity.
        2.Available Quantity is less than task Quantity and sum of Available Quantity & PendIn Quantity
        is less than the task Quantity. (Allowing Partial Picking).

        Tasks are held if
        1.Sum of Available Quantity and PendIn Quantity is greater than task Quantity.(Waiting for the Replenishment to happen).

        Alternate Pick Location is suggested if
        1.Both Available Quantity and pendIn quantity are zero.

        OUTBOUND_PICKING:
        If the Source Location is frozen for pick, getNextTask tries to get an alternate Pick Location.

        Tasks for shipments are not suggested to the user if Shipment sort location is not defined, and container contents are not required.

        If the flag ConsolidateSerials is passed as Y in the input, then tasks for a serial tracked item are consolidated in to a single task, provided they satisfy other conditions for consolidation.

        RETRIEVAL/REPLENISHMENT:
        If the Source Location is frozen for pick, getNextTask tries to get an alternate Pick Location.

        COUNT:
        If paper based inventory movement tasks (OUTBOUND_PICKING/RETRIEVAL/REPLENISHMENT/PUTAWAY) exists from a location, then COUNT tasks for this location are not suggested to the user.


        For movement tasks (OUTBOUND_PICKING/RETRIEVAL/REPLENISHMENT/PUTAWAY) when user skips a task getNextTask API get a task ahead of the current task.
        For COUNT tasks skip exception must be configured to unassign user to get a task ahead of the current task.

        Related Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Output XML Output DTD Error XML Error DTD

        User Exits: This user exit is called before suggesting task. com.yantra.ycp.japi.ue.YCPCanTaskBeSuggestedUE
        *

        Events Raised: None

        Template Support: No

        Configuration Required for Backward Compatibility: No

        Configuration Required for Backward Compatibility: No

        Audits: None

        Pre-conditions: None

        Post-conditions:
        None

        Database Extensibility Support: Yes

        Configuration Required for Backward Compatibility: None

        Parameters:
        env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API.
        inXML - Required. For more information, see the associated input xml files.

        Returns:
        An XML document having the latest task details and the audit details made to the task status on the platform. For details on the output, refer to the associated output files.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - Java's default remote exception handler.
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException - Exception containing error codes in the standard error files.
